trans-unit.source: SMOTE
trans-unit.target: SMOTE

trans-unit.source: Increases the number of low incidence examples in a dataset using synthetic minority oversampling
trans-unit.target: Increases the number of low incidence examples in a dataset using synthetic minority oversampling

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="92B32033-F75F-4854-AC8F-9110B3FE7E09" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Manipulation</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="92B32033-F75F-4854-AC8F-9110B3FE7E09" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Manipulation</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>SMOTE</ui> module to apply the <newTerm>Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique</newTerm> to an input dataset.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>SMOTE</ui> module to apply the <newTerm>Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique</newTerm> to an input dataset.

trans-unit.source: This is a statistical technique for increasing the number of cases in your dataset in a balanced way.
trans-unit.target: This is a statistical technique for increasing the number of cases in your dataset in a balanced way.

trans-unit.source: You use SMOTE in datasets that are <newTerm>imbalanced</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: You use SMOTE in datasets that are <newTerm>imbalanced</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: Typically this means that the class you want to analyze is under-represented.
trans-unit.target: Typically this means that the class you want to analyze is under-represented.

trans-unit.source: There are many reasons for this: the category you are targeting might be very rare in the population, or the data might simply be difficult to collect.
trans-unit.target: There are many reasons for this: the category you are targeting might be very rare in the population, or the data might simply be difficult to collect.

trans-unit.source: Regardless, SMOTE is a better way of increasing the number of rare cases than simply duplicating existing cases.
trans-unit.target: Regardless, SMOTE is a better way of increasing the number of rare cases than simply duplicating existing cases.

trans-unit.source: The module returns a dataset that contains the original samples, plus an additional number of synthetic minority samples, depending on the percentage you specify.
trans-unit.target: The module returns a dataset that contains the original samples, plus an additional number of synthetic minority samples, depending on the percentage you specify.

trans-unit.source: How SMOTE Works
trans-unit.target: How SMOTE Works

trans-unit.source: <ui>SMOTE</ui> works by generating new instances from existing cases that you supply as input.
trans-unit.target: <ui>SMOTE</ui> works by generating new instances from existing cases that you supply as input.

trans-unit.source: The new instances are created by taking samples of the feature space for each target class and its nearest neighbors, and generating new examples that combine features of the target case with features of its neighbors.
trans-unit.target: The new instances are created by taking samples of the feature space for each target class and its nearest neighbors, and generating new examples that combine features of the target case with features of its neighbors.

trans-unit.source: This approach increases the features available to each class and makes the samples more general.
trans-unit.target: This approach increases the features available to each class and makes the samples more general.

trans-unit.source: SMOTE takes the entire dataset as an input and increases the percentage of the minority cases only.
trans-unit.target: SMOTE takes the entire dataset as an input and increases the percentage of the minority cases only.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have an imbalanced dataset with 1% of Class A (the minority class) and 99% of Class B, you would enter 200 to increase the percentage of minority cases to twice the previous percentage.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have an imbalanced dataset with 1% of Class A (the minority class) and 99% of Class B, you would enter 200 to increase the percentage of minority cases to twice the previous percentage.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you try using <ui>SMOTE</ui> with a small dataset to see how it works.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you try using <ui>SMOTE</ui> with a small dataset to see how it works.

trans-unit.source: The following example uses the Blood Donation dataset available in Azure Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: The following example uses the Blood Donation dataset available in Azure Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: If you click <ui>Visualize</ui> on the dataset’s output, you can see that, of the 748 rows or cases in the dataset, there are 570 cases (76%) of Class 0, and 178 cases (24%) of class 1.
trans-unit.target: If you click <ui>Visualize</ui> on the dataset’s output, you can see that, of the 748 rows or cases in the dataset, there are 570 cases (76%) of Class 0, and 178 cases (24%) of class 1.

trans-unit.source: Although this isn’t terribly imbalanced, Class 1 represents the people who donated blood, and thus these rows contain the features you want to model.
trans-unit.target: Although this isn’t terribly imbalanced, Class 1 represents the people who donated blood, and thus these rows contain the features you want to model.

trans-unit.source: To increase the number of cases, you can set the value of <ui>SMOTE percentage</ui> in <legacyBold>multiples of 100</legacyBold> as follows:
trans-unit.target: To increase the number of cases, you can set the value of <ui>SMOTE percentage</ui> in <legacyBold>multiples of 100</legacyBold> as follows:

trans-unit.source: Class 0
trans-unit.target: Class 0

trans-unit.source: Class 1
trans-unit.target: Class 1

trans-unit.source: total
trans-unit.target: total

trans-unit.source: Original dataset
trans-unit.target: Original dataset

trans-unit.source: SMOTE increase = <legacyBold>200</legacyBold>
trans-unit.target: SMOTE increase = <legacyBold>200</legacyBold>

trans-unit.source: SMOTE increase = <legacyBold>300</legacyBold>
trans-unit.target: SMOTE increase = <legacyBold>300</legacyBold>

trans-unit.source: Increasing the number of cases using SMOTE is not guaranteed to produce more accurate models.
trans-unit.target: Increasing the number of cases using SMOTE is not guaranteed to produce more accurate models.

trans-unit.source: You should try experimenting with different percentages, different feature sets, and different numbers of nearest neighbors to see how adding cases influences your model.
trans-unit.target: You should try experimenting with different percentages, different feature sets, and different numbers of nearest neighbors to see how adding cases influences your model.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure SMOTE
trans-unit.target: How to Configure SMOTE

trans-unit.source: Determine which columns in the dataset to use as input.
trans-unit.target: Determine which columns in the dataset to use as input.

trans-unit.source: Creation of new cases using <ui>SMOTE</ui> is based on <legacyBold>all</legacyBold> the columns that you provide as inputs.
trans-unit.target: Creation of new cases using <ui>SMOTE</ui> is based on <legacyBold>all</legacyBold> the columns that you provide as inputs.

trans-unit.source: You cannot select specific columns, or exclude columns.
trans-unit.target: You cannot select specific columns, or exclude columns.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if you want to use a limited feature space for building the new cases, you should use <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> to select those columns before using <ui>SMOTE</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, if you want to use a limited feature space for building the new cases, you should use <link xlink:href="1ec722fa-b623-4e26-a44e-a50c6d726223" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Project Columns</link> to select those columns before using <ui>SMOTE</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the column containing the label, or target class, is marked as such.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the column containing the label, or target class, is marked as such.

trans-unit.source: Use the <link xlink:href="9f3fe1c4-520e-49ac-a152-2e104169912a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> module to select the column that contains the class labels, and select <ui>Label</ui> from the <ui>Fields</ui> dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link xlink:href="9f3fe1c4-520e-49ac-a152-2e104169912a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Metadata Editor</link> module to select the column that contains the class labels, and select <ui>Label</ui> from the <ui>Fields</ui> dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: Based on this metadata, SMOTE identifies the minority class in the label column, and then gets all examples for the minority class.
trans-unit.target: Based on this metadata, SMOTE identifies the minority class in the label column, and then gets all examples for the minority class.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Properties</ui> pane of the <ui>SMOTE</ui> module, indicate the amount by which to increase the proportion of minority cases in the output dataset, by typing a whole number for <ui>SMOTE percentage</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Properties</ui> pane of the <ui>SMOTE</ui> module, indicate the amount by which to increase the proportion of minority cases in the output dataset, by typing a whole number for <ui>SMOTE percentage</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The value must be in multiples of 100.
trans-unit.target: The value must be in multiples of 100.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: You type <legacyBold>50</legacyBold> (%).
trans-unit.target: You type <legacyBold>50</legacyBold> (%).

trans-unit.source: The module returns an error, because that would mean returning fewer minority cases than you started with.
trans-unit.target: The module returns an error, because that would mean returning fewer minority cases than you started with.

trans-unit.source: You type <legacyBold>100</legacyBold> (%).
trans-unit.target: You type <legacyBold>100</legacyBold> (%).

trans-unit.source: The SMOTE module returns exactly the same number of minority cases as in the original dataset.
trans-unit.target: The SMOTE module returns exactly the same number of minority cases as in the original dataset.

trans-unit.source: You type <legacyBold>150</legacyBold> (%).
trans-unit.target: You type <legacyBold>150</legacyBold> (%).

trans-unit.source: The SMOTE module returns an error, because increases must be in units of 100.
trans-unit.target: The SMOTE module returns an error, because increases must be in units of 100.

trans-unit.source: In future releases, this restriction will be removed.
trans-unit.target: In future releases, this restriction will be removed.

trans-unit.source: You type <legacyBold>200</legacyBold> (%).
trans-unit.target: You type <legacyBold>200</legacyBold> (%).

trans-unit.source: The module doubles the percentage of minority cases in the original dataset.
trans-unit.target: The module doubles the percentage of minority cases in the original dataset.

trans-unit.source: Note that this does not result in having twice as many minority cases as before.
trans-unit.target: Note that this does not result in having twice as many minority cases as before.

trans-unit.source: SMOTE never changes the number of majority cases.
trans-unit.target: SMOTE never changes the number of majority cases.

trans-unit.source: Rather, the size of the dataset is increased in such a way that the number of majority cases stays the same, and the number of minority cases is increased till it matches the desired percentage value.
trans-unit.target: Rather, the size of the dataset is increased in such a way that the number of majority cases stays the same, and the number of minority cases is increased till it matches the desired percentage value.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Properties</ui> pane, use the <ui>Number of nearest neighbors</ui> option to determine the size of the feature space that the SMOTE algorithm uses when in building new cases.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Properties</ui> pane, use the <ui>Number of nearest neighbors</ui> option to determine the size of the feature space that the SMOTE algorithm uses when in building new cases.

trans-unit.source: A <newTerm>nearest neighbor</newTerm> is a row of data (a case) that is very similar to some target case.
trans-unit.target: A <newTerm>nearest neighbor</newTerm> is a row of data (a case) that is very similar to some target case.

trans-unit.source: The distance between any two cases is measured by combining the weighted vectors of all features.
trans-unit.target: The distance between any two cases is measured by combining the weighted vectors of all features.

trans-unit.source: By increasing the number of nearest neighbors, you get features from more cases.
trans-unit.target: By increasing the number of nearest neighbors, you get features from more cases.

trans-unit.source: By keeping the number of nearest neighbors low, you use features that are more like those in the original sample.
trans-unit.target: By keeping the number of nearest neighbors low, you use features that are more like those in the original sample.

trans-unit.source: SMOTE Options
trans-unit.target: SMOTE Options

trans-unit.source: You can change the way the SMOTE algorithm works by setting these parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can change the way the SMOTE algorithm works by setting these parameters:

trans-unit.source: SMOTE percentage
trans-unit.target: SMOTE percentage

trans-unit.source: Type a number, in a multiple of 100, that represents the desired percentage increase for the minority cases only.
trans-unit.target: Type a number, in a multiple of 100, that represents the desired percentage increase for the minority cases only.

trans-unit.source: The size of the output dataset is equal to the original samples plus an additional number of synthetic minority samples.
trans-unit.target: The size of the output dataset is equal to the original samples plus an additional number of synthetic minority samples.

trans-unit.source: Number of nearest neighbors
trans-unit.target: Number of nearest neighbors

trans-unit.source: Type a value that specifies the number of nearest neighbors to use in building feature space for new cases.
trans-unit.target: Type a value that specifies the number of nearest neighbors to use in building feature space for new cases.

trans-unit.source: Table
trans-unit.target: Table

trans-unit.source: A <link xlink:href="285668ca-bd74-42b2-9c2c-3111b4819e56" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DataTable</link> containing the original samples plus an additional number of synthetic minority class samples.
trans-unit.target: A <link xlink:href="285668ca-bd74-42b2-9c2c-3111b4819e56" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DataTable</link> containing the original samples plus an additional number of synthetic minority class samples.

trans-unit.source: The number of new samples is (smotePercent/100)*T, where T is the number of minority class samples.
trans-unit.target: The number of new samples is (smotePercent/100)*T, where T is the number of minority class samples.
